hero.title: Punto de Agua
hero.subtitle: A free tool born to make water management in your town simpler, always ensuring that water remains a public good.

features.title: Total control over your town's water
features.subtitle: Forget about papers and manual calculations. With Punto de Agua, everything is saved and organized, you no longer have to rely only on your memory or notes. Discover how to transform water management into a simple task.

userRegistry.title: User Registry
userRegistry.description: Have all the information of each meter organized in its file, all key data, centralized and at hand.

calendar.title: Task and Reading Calendar
calendar.description: Your task calendar centralizes readings and controls, with alerts that prevent anything from being left pending.

analytics.title: Analytics and Reports Control
analytics.description: All your chlorine, pH and consumption measurements in one place. Ready to consult or print.

hackersdays.title: Hackers Days
hackersdays.description: Punto de Agua was born during the Hackers Days by Rural Hackers, a collaborative meeting to create an open and free solution for community water management.

alliance.title: Alliance for rural areas
alliance.description: A union between neighbors and technological talent to create useful solutions that respond to the real needs of rural areas.

activate.title: Activate your town
activate.subtitle: Register your community to start managing your water
activate.step1: Punto de Agua was born during Hackers Days, a collaborative meeting to create an open and free solution.
activate.step2: Completely developed in open source, it is available for any water community to use.
activate.step3: If your town wants to benefit from a simple tool, it can start today.
activate.ctaButton: Activate me in Punto de Agua

form.documentDescription: Attach the document that accredits you as responsible for managing water (ex: Water Association constitution act)

contributors.title: Team
contributors.subtitle: Thanks to these people and organizations, Punto de Agua is today an open and free resource.
